oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Stress-strain behavior of composites under high strain rate compression along thickness direction: Effect of loading condition
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: NAIK, NK
RAO, KV
VEERRAJU, C
RAVIKUMAR, G
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: mechanical-properties
specimen geometry
strength
failure
polymer matrix composites
mechanical properties
impact
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Investigations are carried out on the behavior of typical plain weave E-glass/epoxy; plain weave carbon/epoxy; satin weave carbon/epoxy; and satin weave carbon - plain weave E-glass and epoxy hybrid composites under high strain rate compressive loading along thickness direction. Compressive split Hopkinson pressure bar apparatus was used for the studies. Two loading cases, namely, specimen not failed and specimen failed during loading are investigated. The special characteristics of specimen not failed case are presented. For this case, the specimens are under compressive strain initially and are under tensile strain during the later part of loading. The induced tensile strain is higher than the induced compressive strain. This could lead to failure of specimen/structure under tensile strain even though the applied load is compressive. (C) 2009 Elsevier Ltd.
